meanings.definition: A person who examines and evaluates literary or artistic works.
meanings.sent1: The recensors at the art gallery carefully studied each painting.
meanings.sent2: The recensors praised the author's latest novel for its creativity and depth.
meanings.sent3: The recensors at the museum had a tough job deciding which sculpture was the best.
meanings.sent4: As recensors of the poetry contest, they had the challenging task of selecting the winner.
meanings.sent5: The recensors' keen eye for detail helped them identify the most talented artists.

meanings.sent1: She recensors her own work before submitting it for publication.
meanings.sent2: The film critic recensors movies to provide insightful reviews to the audience.
meanings.sent3: He recensors his friend's cooking skills with a playful sense of humor.
meanings.sent4: The teacher recensors the students' essays with a constructive approach.
meanings.sent5: Recensoring the data allowed them to identify areas for improvement in the project.

meanings.definition: The act of assessing or judging the quality of something.
meanings.sent1: The recensors of the competition had a difficult task ahead.
meanings.sent2: Her recensors of the new restaurant were positive, praising the delicious food.
meanings.sent3: The recensors of the fashion show had a fun time rating the outfits.
meanings.sent4: Recensors of the music festival had to make tough decisions on the performers.
meanings.sent5: Their recensors of the product highlighted its strengths and weaknesses.
